Animating a dialog box using the Ext.Msg class and Ext JS

The following example shows how you can add an animation when a dialog box opens and closes on an Ext.Msg dialog box using the static Ext.Msg.show() method and specifying the animateTarget config option.

Tags: Ext JS Ext JS 4.0.7 Ext.MessageBox Ext.Msg show() animateTarget
[example]
© 2012 Sencha Inc. 
/*global Ext:false */
Ext.onReady(function () {
    Ext.create('Ext.Button', {
        id: 'btn',
        text: 'Click to launch dialog',
        handler: function () {
            Ext.Msg.show({
                animateTarget: 'btn',
                title: 'Everyday I\'m animatin\'',
                msg: 'I should have animated relative to the Ext.Button instance.

Didn\'t see? Close the dialog and try again.'
            });
        },
        renderTo: Ext.getBody()
    });
});
